## Summary
Initialize the SvelteKit 2.x application with Svelte 5 in `apps/web`. Set up the foundational route groups, layout structure, and build configuration per DD-08.

## Requirements

### SvelteKit Project Initialization
- SvelteKit 2.x with Svelte 5 (runes mode)
- TypeScript (strict mode, linked to root tsconfig.base.json)
- Vite as build tool
- Adapter: `@sveltejs/adapter-node` (for SSR + container deployment)

### Route Group Structure (DD-08 Section 7)
```
src/
  routes/
    (public)/
      +layout.svelte
      +page.svelte           # Landing/marketing page placeholder
    (auth)/
      +layout.svelte
      login/+page.svelte     # Login page placeholder
    (game)/
      +layout.svelte
      +page.svelte           # Game terminal placeholder
    (admin)/
      +layout.svelte
      +page.svelte           # Admin dashboard placeholder
  lib/
    api/                     # API client (placeholder)
    game/                    # Game-specific state and logic (DD-08 Section 7 & 10)
      state/
        reducer.ts           # Game state reducer (event-sourced)
        events.ts            # Immutable game event types
        selectors.ts         # Typed state selectors
        state-machine.ts     # Phase-driven game state machine
      services/              # Game services (placeholder)
        action-queue.ts      # Action queue for server submission
        replay.ts            # Event replay for undo/redo and saves
        sync.ts              # Server-authoritative state reconciliation
    ui/
      components/            # Shared UI components
      tokens/                # Design token stubs
    stores/                  # Cross-cutting Svelte stores (session, theme, settings, connectivity, notifications)
    utils/                   # Utility functions
  hooks.server.ts            # Server hooks (placeholder)
  hooks.client.ts            # Client hooks (placeholder)
  app.css                    # Global CSS with token imports
  app.html                   # HTML shell with data-theme attribute
```

> **`lib/game/` vs `lib/stores/` distinction (DD-08 Section 10):**
> `lib/stores/` holds cross-cutting Svelte stores for concerns shared across the entire app (session, theme, settings, connectivity, notifications). `lib/game/` contains game-specific state management: the event-sourced reducer, typed selectors, state machine, and game services. Game modules under `lib/game/` must not import from `lib/admin/` or vice versa (DD-08 boundary rules).

### Configuration
- `svelte.config.js` with proper aliases ($lib, $api, etc.)
- `vite.config.ts` with proxy to backend API (localhost:3001)
- Path aliases: `$lib`, `$api`, `$ui`, `$stores`, `$utils`, `$game`

### Placeholder Pages
- Each route group gets a minimal placeholder page
- Root layout with `data-theme="green"` attribute on `<html>`
- Basic CSS reset in `app.css`

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `pnpm --filter web dev` starts the dev server
- [ ] All 4 route groups render placeholder content
- [ ] TypeScript compiles without errors
- [ ] Hot module reload works
- [ ] Path aliases resolve correctly (including `$game`)
- [ ] Proxy to backend API is configured in Vite
- [ ] `lib/game/state/` directory exists with placeholder type stubs for GameState and game events

## References
- DD-08 Section 7: Project Structure and Module Boundaries
- DD-08 Section 8: Routing and Layout Architecture
- DD-08 Section 10: State Management Strategy (layered state, game vs cross-cutting stores)
- MILESTONES.md: M0 "Monorepo structure" (SvelteKit frontend)

## Dependencies
- M0-01: Initialize pnpm monorepo workspace
